alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 9:42AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hancock, Henderson, Warren, McDonough, Henry, Des Moines, Lee and eastern Clark Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 941 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Westwood to 7 miles south of Kahoka. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wayland around 945 AM CDT. New London, Warsaw, Alexandria and Mount Union around 955 AM CDT. Danville around 1000 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Mediapolis, West Burlington, West Point, Burlington, Gulf Port, Oquawka, Bowen, Gladstone, Augusta, Biggsville and Rozetta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
